title: Brooklyn Bridge
description: Opened in 1883, the Brooklyn Bridge provides passage between Brooklyn and Manhattan for motorists, trains, bicycles and pedestrians. One of the primary symbols of New York City, it is a marvel of design and provides spectacular views of the city's skyline.

title: Barclay Center
description: Place to hang out and have fun watching concerts, basketball match, everything happens here!

title: Brooklyn Heights Promenade
description: Offering magnificent views of the Manhattan skyline and the Brooklyn Bridge, this 1/3-mile-long sliver of green overlooks Brooklyn's busy industrial waterfront.

title: Grand Army Plaza
description: Grand Army Plaza comprises the northern corner and the main entrance of Prospect Park in the borough of Brooklyn, New York City, and consists of concentric oval rings arranged as streets, with the outer ring being the namesake Plaza Street.

title: Brooklyn Boulders
description: Brooklyn is a dedicated rock climbing facility and dynamic.

title: Brooklyn Academy of Music
description: Founded in 1859, this performing arts center is the oldest institution of its type still in operation in the United States.

title: Galapagos Art Space
description: Eddings brooklyn art music cabaret downtown cool hip fun sexy sensual design dance theater trapeze aerial wedding holiday party christmas DUMBO.

title: Sideshows by the Seashore
description: This sideshow has the usual sword-swallower and bed-of-nails artist, plus other unique players.

title: Glasslands Gallery
description: In South Williamsburg since 2006, Glasslands is a converted warehouse, formerly a homegrown community art space turned psychedelic venue partyhaus. Bring your friend, see the bands, try our beer, make out in the photobooth.

title: Brooklyn Art Library
description: Intimate art space & music venue in a converted Brooklyn warehouse with a balcony & a photo booth.

title: Smogasburg
address: Brooklyn Bridge Park Pier 5, Brooklyn, NY
description: Located at Pier 5 in Brooklyn Bridge Park on Sundays, this location of Smorgasburg is a weekly food festival of over 100 food vendors.

title: Brooklyn Brewery
description: Commercial brewery, founded in 1987 and located in an 1860s-era former steel foundry, features a Tasting Room, warehouse and a 300-seat facility for community events.

title: Chuko
description: Izakaya across from Chuko serving sake, beer, whiskey & cocktails to go with Japanese small plates.

title: Sycamore
description: Izakaya across from Chuko serving sake, beer, whiskey & cocktails to go with Japanese small plates.

title: Bergen Hill
description: New American seafood, small plates & craft sips in an intimate space with a bar & patio tables.

title: Brooklyn Flea
description: Flea markets every weekend of the year that feature hundreds of top vendors of furniture, vintage clothing, collectibles and antiques. Plus delicious fresh food.

title: Jacques Torres Chocolate
description: Chocolate shop and factory tour.

title: Brooklyn Night Bazaar
description: Brooklyn Night Bazaar is a confluence of night market, art fair, food festival and concert that brings together New York's creative independent vendors, musicians, chefs, artists breweries and wineries. Always free to enter.

title: Mast Brothers
description: Mast Brothers Chocolate Makers offers a variety of single estate and single origin chocolates as well as our first house blend.

title: Brooklyn Denim Co
description: Brooklyn Denim Co. is committed to providing a large and varied selection of premium denim products and denim related services. Our Williamsburg neighborhood and surrounding area provides us with inspiration, creativity and a great environment in which to ply our trade.

title: Brooklyn Bridge Park
description: Brooklyn Bridge Park in Brooklyn has new ‘destination’ playgrounds, including a Water Lab to cool off in summer, Slide Mountain, Swing Valley and the baby friendly Sandbox Village. Jane’s Carousel, in a glass-enclosed pavilion, has restored horses from 1922.

title: Coney Island
description: Home to famous rides like the Cyclone Roller Coaster, the Wonder Wheel and the Parachute Jump, this historic seaside section of Broooklyn is about an hour by train from Manhattan and still boasts a lively boardwalk, beach, and the best hot dogs around.

title: Prospect Park
description: Brooklyn's answer to Central Park, Prospect Park contains a zoo, an audubon center and the Brooklyn Museum of Art. Its entrance is marked by the large Memorial Arch and it is a mecca for families and nature lovers who go to play ball, bird watch and listen to outdoor concerts.

title: Brooklyn Botanical Garden
description: A hot spot for proposals and weddings, the gardens 52 acres of magnificent flora and fauna provide the perfect romantic background. In late spring, the well-known Cranford Rose Garden features tens of thousands of roses flowing down arches, climbing up lattices and standing in formal beds.

title: New York Aquarium
description: Situated on 14 acres by the sea in Coney Island, the Aquarium is home to over 8,000 animals. The Aquarium provides an enjoyable experience for the whole family. See friendly walruses, amazing sharks, playful sea otters and so much more.
